question: In what natural material are large amounts of metals like iron and aluminum often found?

content.source_1: Large amounts of metals are found in Earth’s crust; aluminum (~8% by mass) and iron (~5%) are among the most abundant crustal elements.
content.source_4: Earth’s core is composed predominantly of metallic iron with nickel and contains the majority of the planet’s metal mass.
content.source_5: The crust accounts for well under 1% of Earth’s mass, so only a small fraction of Earth’s total metal inventory resides in the crust compared with the core.
content.source_6: Geochemists identify the core as Earth’s principal metal reservoir because it holds by far the largest mass of metallic elements.
